item.title: The Trans Woman Who Sued the Federal Prisons (and Won) Settles Her Remaining Cases
item.description: Days before Trump’s inauguration, the Bureau of Prisons agreed to pay Grace Pinson $95,000 to drop more than a dozen pending lawsuits.

item.title: How Trump’s Immigration Orders Represent a Seismic Shift on Enforcement
item.description: The president’s actions move the federal government toward his promised hardline position. But some executive orders will face court challenges.

item.title: Trump’s Order Takes Aim at Transgender People in Prison
item.description: Few trans people receive gender-affirming housing and care in the federal prison system. This executive order would make it even harder.

item.title: ‘Nobody’s Trying to Help Him’: Deaths in Cuyahoga County Jail Intensify Scrutiny
item.description: Videos depicting two men’s final moments, and the response by guards, raise alarms at the embattled jail where at least 24 people have died since 2018...

item.title: What Will Trump’s Executive Order on Private Prisons Really Do?
item.description: The order reverses Biden’s ban on private prison contracts with the Justice Department. Private immigrant detention never stopped and is expected to g...
